issue.title: FCD Ballot Comment GB-118
issue.discussion: vector<bool> iterators are not random access iterators because their reference type is a special class, and not 'bool &'. All standard libary operations taking iterators should treat this iterator as if it was a random access iterator, rather than a simple input iterator.
issue.resolution: Either revise the iterator requirements to support proxy iterators (restoring functionality that was lost when the Concept facility was removed) or add an extra paragraph to the vector<bool> specification requiring the library to treat vector<bool> iterators as-if they were random access iterators, despite having the wrong reference type.
